snippet.title: Johnny Depp called ex-wife 'Amber Turd' in row after finding poo in bed
snippet.description: More details about Johnny Depp and Amber Heard 's private relationship have been made public on the fourth day of his libel trial against News Group Newspapers.   New information heard in court reveals that Johnny, 57, made "Amber Turd" jokes after blaming her for faeces he found in their bed the day after Amber's birthday party on April 21, 2016.  He told the court that while he believes Amber, 34, was responsible for the defecation, he admitting under questioning that it could have been her "crass" friend, trans activist iO Tillett Wright.  Johnny arrived at Amber's party two hours later after he got some bad news about his financial affairs from his accountants.    He also smoked some cannabis to relieve his stress.  The Hollywood actor admitted that he went to bed to read a book after the other guests had left and he and Amber argued about his behaviour.  Amber claimed that as the confrontation escalated, Johnny threw a magnum champagne bottle at her, shoved her to the floor several times and then left a note which read "Happy F***ing Birthday".    Johnny claimed that Amber had been "drinking heavily" and had attacked him while he had been reading in bed, alleging she punched him in the face four times before he grabbed her arms to stop her.  He went on to say that the next day either Amber or one of her friends "defecated" in their bed, and he believes it was Amber as she reportedly told the building manager it was "just a harmless prank".   The dad-of-two claimed this was when he "resolved" to divorce her.  Johnny denied that their small dog could have been responsible for the mess, but did admit that Amber's friend iO Tillett Wright could have been responsible.  He said he could not be certain that Amber was responsible.  The Pirates of the Caribbean star admitted that he laughed about the faeces the next day and made "Amber Turd" jokes.   Amber alleged that a month later, Johnny returned to their LA apartment to collect his belongings after deciding to divorce her.  She claimed that another argument began during which he allegedly threw a phone.  Johnny denied this, claiming he did not touch her.  The trial was launched in relation to an article published in The Sun which made allegations of violence from Johnny towards Amber, something which he denies.
